intro: Matricaria minima, commonly known as lesser chamomile, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its daisy-like flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a white center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Matricaria minima is often used in herbal medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
